title: Harmattan AI raises $200M Series B led by Dassault Aviation, becomes defense unicorn
summary: French defense tech company Harmattan AI is now valued at $1.4 billion after raising a $200 million Series B round led by Dassault Aviation, which is best known for making the Rafale fighter jet.

title: These Gen Zers just raised $11.75M to put Africa’s defense back in the hands of Africans
summary: African defense company Terra comes out of stealth with a $11.75M round led by Joe Lonsdale's 8VC.

title: inDrive turns to ads and groceries to diversify revenue
summary: Advertising on inDrive is being rolled out across its top 20 markets following mid-2025 tests.

title: Motional puts AI at center of robotaxi reboot as it targets 2026 for driverless service
summary: Motional says it will launch a driverless robotaxi service in Las Vegas before the end of 2026.

title: Google co-founders may be leaving California
summary: Sergey Brin and Larry Page appear to be pulling back from the state where they co-founded Google.

title: Instagram says there’s been ‘no breach’ despite password reset requests
summary: Instagram says that although some users received suspicious-looking password reset requests, it has not been breached.

title: Google removes AI Overviews for certain medical queries
summary: This follows an investigation by the Guardian that found Google AI Overviews offering misleading information in response to some health-related queries.

title: Nuclear startups are back in vogue with small reactors, and big challenges
summary: Small modular reactor startups are betting that mass manufacturing will help them bring costs down. But are they underestimating the challenge?

title: Indonesia and Malaysia block Grok over non-consensual, sexualized deepfakes
summary: Indonesian officials said Saturday that they are temporarily blocking access to xAI’s chatbot Grok.

title: X restricts Grok’s image generation to paying subscribers only after drawing the world’s ire
summary: Elon Musk's AI company has restricted Grok's controversial AI image-generation feature to only paying subscribers on X, after the tool invited heated criticism from across the world for letting users generate sexualized images of women and children.

title: The venture firm that ate Silicon Valley just raised another $15 billion

title: How next-generation nuclear reactors break out of the 20th-century blueprint
summary: Commercial nuclear reactors all work pretty much the same way. Atoms of a radioactive material split, emitting neutrons.
